turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Derfflinger-class battlecruiser.
turn.1: What were the main features of the hull?

turn.3: What did the critics say about the hull?
turn.4: The ships were regarded as excellent sea boats by the German navy.
turn.5: Did the hull have any weaknesses?
turn.6: The "Derfflinger"-class ships were described as having had gentle motion, though they were "wet" at the casemate deck.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: The ships lost up to 65% speed with the twin rudders hard over, and heeled up to 11 degrees.
turn.9: How did they address the issue of speed?
turn.10: This was greater than any of the preceding battlecruiser designs, and as a result, anti-roll tanks were fitted to "Derfflinger".
